title: Raducanu's Resilient Victory at Transylvania Open
summary: Emma Raducanu demonstrated remarkable resilience by overcoming a 5-0 deficit in the first set to defeat Kaja Juvan 7-5, 6-1 in the last 16 of the Transylvania Open in Romania. This victory, achieved shortly after parting ways with her coach Francis Roig, featured Raducanu winning 11 consecutive games. She attributed her comeback to the supportive crowd and acknowledged Juvan's strong play that initially pressured her. Raducanu emphasized her aggressive strategy, despite early errors, and noted this was her first comeback from such a scoreline. The win advances her to the quarter-finals against Maja Chwalinska. Additionally, the article mentions Sonay Kartal's success at the Abu Dhabi Open, where she reached the last eight after Belinda Bencic withdrew due to illness, highlighting Kartal's career-high ranking.
